title: Everyday English Course 69
description: Improve your English comprehension skills through short everyday conversations and situational dialogues.

sections.title: Section 1: English Practice
sections.description: Learn to understand and respond to basic English dialogues used in daily situations.

sections.title: Section 2: English Practice
sections.description: Learn to understand and respond to basic English dialogues used in daily situations.

questionTemplates.text:
W: Isn't Frank supposed to arrive in Chicago this morning? Ms. Tylor is waiting for him.
M: He's just called to say his flight was canceled. He won't be able to arrive until the afternoon.
W: Hmm, could you call him and ask him to email his report to Ms. Tylor then?
{a}

answerOptions: He will arrive in Chicago this morning.
He will send Ms. Tyler an e-mail.
He will call Ms. Tyler himself.
instances.correctAnswer: He will send Ms. Tyler an e-mail.

variables.a: What do you know about Frank?

answerOptions: The man didn't practice hard enough.
The man should find a new partner.
The man should not give up.
instances.correctAnswer: The man should not give up.

variables.a: What does the woman mean?
Who should answer the telephone?

questionTemplates.text:
W: Do you mind if I turn the TV off?
M: Can't you see the football match hasn't finished yet?
W: But the baby is already in bed.
M: Oh, all right. You always get your way.
{a}

answerOptions: He doesn't care if it is turned off.
He thinks the woman is right.
He is reluctant to turn it off.
instances.correctAnswer: He is reluctant to turn it off.
